intro: Laurentia erinoides f. erecta, commonly known as the upright form of the marsh woundwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Boraginaceae. It is characterized by its erect growth habit, with slender, branching stems that often reach heights of up to 30 centimeters. The plant produces small, blue to purple flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom from late spring to early autumn. Its leaves are opposite, ovate to lanceolate, and often have a hairy texture. It thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils and is typically found in wetlands, stream banks, and other aquatic or semi-aquatic habitats.
